dta.MultiArray¶

class dta.MultiArray(dtype, dimElements, numpyArray=None, isBase=True)¶

Bases: object

Multidimentinal array of custom numpy data types supporting string indices, arbitrary slicing and aggregation

__init__(dtype, dimElements, numpyArray=None, isBase=True)¶

asPrettyString()¶

Return the array as a properly formated string

asPrettyString4()¶

Return a four dimentional array as a property formated string

changeTranslationForDim(dimIndex, oldElementsToNew)¶
collapse(alphaToBeta)¶

Collapses the current array into fewer dimensions input: a numpy array with the following fields “alpha”, “beta”, “percentage”. The current zoneIds are in the “alpha” fields, the new ones in the “beta” fields.

copy()¶

Return a copy of the current Multi Array

eliminateDimention(dimIndex)¶

Return the sum accross dimention dimIndex

expand(alphaToBeta)¶

Expands the current dimentions of multiArray.

Input a numpy array with the following fields “alpha”, “beta”, “percentage” Output: a new Multi Array

fill(value)¶
getDataType()¶

Return the data type of the elements in the array

getElementsOfAllDimentions()¶

Return a tuple with the elements of all dimentions

getElementsOfDimention(dimIndex)¶

Returns a tuple of all the indices of the dimention provided

getItemSize()¶

Return the element byte size

getNumDim()¶

Return the number of dimentions

getNumpyArray()¶

Return a reference to the stored data as multidimentional numpy array

getShape()¶

Return a tupble of integers indicating the size of the array in each dimention

getSize()¶

Return the number of items stored in the array

getSum()¶

return the sum of all the items in the array

iteritems()¶
iterkeys()¶
itervalues()¶

return an iterator over the values

multiplyInPlace(value)¶

Multiply all the items of the array with the provided value

pickle(fileName)¶

Save the pickled multiarray in the given file

classmethod read(fileName)¶

Read the multiArray from disk and return it

classmethod unpickle(fileName)¶

Unpickle and return the multiarray saved in the given file

write(fileName)¶

Write the multidimentional array to file using the numpy binary format

writeToCSV(fileName)¶

Save the multiarry as a comma delimited text file
